column5: Sleeping in with the boys waiting in my driveway meant we wouldn't get on the water till 8:30am. Nice morning with calm winds and overcast skies. Set up and made one pass with nothing to show so we make our run to different water.  Marked fish throughout the water column but only a few signs of anything on the larger side. Three passes yielded 4 fish in the 7-9 lb range and one 3 lber while dropping one more. Must have hit the morning major there because it went quiet after that.  One more move saw one more fish becoming unbuttoned on the way to the boat. Packed up and pulled out by 4pm. Marked water as low as 33'5 degrees and ran into some thin ice so its only a matter of time. With temps hovering around or just above freezing next week we hope to make it out one last time.
Nice gold there Moxie.  You got out and caught and had a day of it  Nice.

I just posted a topic at the same time as you did this Moxie re: getting out today. Looks a lot colder there than here on the north Erie shoreline. Braving the cold sure paid off for you my man. Quinte? edit: of course it is, the jpeg says so, duhh.Those are some fat beauties you got there. Way to go, your the Dad of the day. I'm available for adoption.
Good way to end the season I'd say...tempting fate by trying to get out again!
As a late season guy... Good for you for getting out... We are a different breed....
